content.question: In the passage above, Horace makes two related observations on the theme of "the golden mean."(a) In lines 5-9 (Sperat . . . summovet), Horace uses pairs of words to illustrate opposites. Write out and translate one of these pairs of opposites. (b) Briefly explain how this pair of contrasting words relates to the theme.

frqParts.text: In the passage above, Horace makes two related observations on the theme of "the golden mean."(a) In lines 5-9 (Sperat . . . summovet), Horace uses pairs of words to illustrate opposites. Write out and translate one of these pairs of opposites. (b) Briefly explain how this pair of contrasting words relates to the theme.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
